definition: to overhaul/to examine and fix (a motor)/to service (a vehicle)
to check/to examine/to inspect/to exercise restraint
to decorate/to embellish/to repair/to build/to write/to cultivate/to study/to take (a class)

sentences.chinese: 必要時要加濾網，定期檢修及設置旁通管路。

sentences.english: A novel unit maintenance scheduling (UMS) model based on the competitive market mechanism is proposed.
sentences.chinese: 構建了基於市場競爭機制的機組檢修規劃模型。

sentences.english: The car needs a good going-over before it can go a long journey.
sentences.chinese: 輛車要跑長途，就要給它徹底檢修一下。

sentences.english: Companies with advanced production equipment, complete equipment maintenance.
sentences.chinese: 公司生產設備先進，檢修設備齊全。

sentences.english: This paper introduces the applications of guided worksheet in Automotive Engine Diagnosis and Repair curriculum.
sentences.chinese: 介紹了引導式工單在汽車發動機檢修課程的應用。

sentences.english: Expenses for repairing and maintenance were reduced after the low frequency sound wave deashing device was used.
sentences.chinese: 經採用低頻聲波清灰裝置，減少了檢修和維護的費用。

sentences.english: Would you mind giving the engine of my car a going-over?
sentences.chinese: 你能檢修一下我的汽車的發動機嗎？

sentences.english: The door cover of the host can be opened for convenience of maintenance and replacement of cutters.
sentences.chinese: 主機門蓋可打開，便於檢修和刀具的更換。

sentences.english: Finally introduced the Sangtana motor car engine idling regime not steady overhaul example.

sentences.english: There is an observation window on the hatches available for watching during operation.
sentences.chinese: 檢修口上設有觀察窗，在攪拌過程中方便觀察。

sentences.english: Contrary to caricature, the French economy does not need a complete overhaul.
sentences.chinese: 但法國經濟不需要完整的檢修。

sentences.english: I must look into the garage on the way home to book a service for the car.
sentences.chinese: 回家時我得順路到汽車修理廠去預約檢修汽車的事情。

definition: pipeline/general term for pipes, cables etc
(of a pendulum) to stop swinging/(of work, production, activities etc) to come to a halt/to be suspended/to be canceled/shutdown/(sports) lockout
to repair in a rush/rush repairs
to keep a promise/to honor an agreement
to break the rules/to violate regulations
to eliminate dust (i.e. filter out suspended particles)
